tasks.name: Identify Risks
tasks.description: Brainstorm and identify functional, technical, and operational risks

completeness.description: Identify risks in three categories: functional, technical, and operational.
Consider risks in different stages of the product lifecycle.
Consider past, present and future risks.

quality.description: High quality risk identification should consider the risks from envrionmental level to product level and to the components level

presentation.description: Present identified risks in a fault tree diagram

tasks.name: Assess Risks
tasks.description: Evaluate identified risks based on their severity and frequency.

completeness.description: Assess all identified risks for both severity and frequency.

quality.description: High quality assessment of risks should be supported by sources

presentation.description: Present assessments in the specified format: [Risk ID/name]: severity[++] / frequency[- -]

AccidentOverview.Main story: Wouter Weylandt, a professional Belgian cyclist, tragically died on May 9, 2011, during the third stage of the Giro d'Italia. The accident occurred during a high-speed descent on the Passo del Bocco.
AccidentOverview.Location: Passo del Bocco descent, Giro d'Italia, Italy

Incident Description.Summary: Wouter Weylandt was descending a mountain pass at high speed during the race.
Details: He lost control of his bike on a turn, leading to a severe crash.
The impact resulted in fatal injuries, including skull fractures and massive internal bleeding.

Factors Contributing To The Accident.HighSpeed: Descending mountain passes at high speeds increases the risk of losing control.
Factors Contributing To The Accident.SharpTurn: The specific turn where the accident occurred was very sharp, demanding precise handling and control.
Factors Contributing To The Accident.EquipmentFailure: Although not confirmed in this case, equipment failure can exacerbate the severity of accidents. Ensuring all components are functioning correctly is crucial.

HighSpeedDescentControl.Risk: Difficulty in maintaining control at high speeds, especially on technical descents.
HighSpeedDescentControl.Analysis: Weylandt lost control while descending a mountain pass at approximately 80 km/h (50 mph), highlighting the risk of high-speed descents where control and stability are crucial.

SharpTurns.Risk: Navigating sharp turns at high speeds.
SharpTurns.Analysis: The accident occurred on a sharp bend, illustrating the need for designs that allow better handling and stability during abrupt directional changes.

BrakingEfficiency.Analysis: Effective braking is vital to control speed, especially during descents. Although not explicitly cited as a failure in this case, ensuring reliable and powerful braking systems is crucial.

StructuralIntegrity.Risk: The durability and strength of bike components under high-stress conditions.
StructuralIntegrity.Analysis: The impact of Weylandt's crash caused severe injuries, emphasizing the need for robust materials and construction that can withstand extreme forces.

RiderVisibilityAndAwareness.Analysis: Weylandt looked back over his shoulder before the crash, which might have contributed to his loss of control. Ensuring that the design does not impair rider visibility and encourages constant awareness is important.

EmergencyResponseAndSafetyProtocols.Risk: Delay or inefficiency in emergency response.
EmergencyResponseAndSafetyProtocols.Analysis: Despite immediate medical attention, Weylandt's injuries were too severe. This highlights the importance of having efficient safety protocols and rapid response measures in place during races.

HelmetAndProtectiveGear.Risk: Ineffectiveness of protective gear in extreme crashes.
HelmetAndProtectiveGear.Analysis: Weylandt was wearing a helmet, yet the impact caused fatal injuries. This underscores the need for continuous improvement in protective gear technology and its integration with the bike design.

Functional Risks.description: Functional risks pertain to the performance and behavior of a product or system in fulfilling its intended purpose
Functional Risks.aspects: Aspects to consider usability, performance, reliability, compliance, interoperability, security, accessibility, and aesthetics.

Technical Risks.description: Technical risks pertain to the design, implementation, and maintenance of a product or system
Technical Risks.aspects: The aspects of technical risks cover design flaws, technological limitations, implementation failures, integration issues, scalability problems, maintenance and durability, testing and quality assurance, and resource constraints.

Operational Risks.description: Operational risks involve potential failures in the day-to-day operations and processes
Operational Risks.aspects: The aspects of operational risks cover process failures, human errors, system failures, external events, compliance issues, organizational changes, supply chain disruptions, and communication breakdowns.
